definition: to report (an offense to the authorities)/to inform against sb
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Bill must have grassed on us.
sentences.chinese: 比尔一定检举揭发了我们。

sentences.english: A player on the sports team blew the whistle on the gambling scandal.
sentences.chinese: 体育队的选手检举赌博弊案的秘辛。

sentences.english: It is short of prosecutive right of civil servant in civil servant system.
sentences.chinese: 公务员的检举权在公务员制度中是有所缺失的。

sentences.english: Leaf GongJin rediscovered the briefcase, but there is in a cloud of hair impeach him.
sentences.chinese: 叶公瑾找回了公文包，但里头有份程云发检举他的信。

sentences.english: I know Lily cheated on the test. Should we rat her out?
sentences.chinese: 我知道李莉考试作弊了，我们该不该把她检举出来。

sentences.english: Nearly three-quarters of individuals reporting a bribe said they had been asked for bribes more than once.
sentences.chinese: 将近四分之三的检举者称受到不止一次的索贿。

sentences.english: The judge was impeached for taking a bribe.
sentences.chinese: 这个法官被检举接受贿赂。

sentences.english: Prosecutors said the “Illegals Program” extended to other countries around the world.
sentences.chinese: 检举者说这些非法组织已经扩展到世界其他国家中了。

sentences.english: If you are small size, the spotter can actually support you at the waist level.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是体积小，检举实际上可以支持你的腰部水平。

sentences.english: Twenty-one percent of those reporting bribe demands did not attach a monetary value to the demand.
The judge was impeached for taking a bribe.
A federal whistle-blower law protects employees who disclose their employers’ illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 一部联邦检举法保护揭露雇主违法活动的雇员。

sentences.english: It's said that those government officials who had blown the whistle also got transferred.
sentences.chinese: 据说检举这件事的官员也被调职了。

sentences.english: If inform against person feel no-go , also welcome direct to judiciary impeach.
sentences.chinese: 假如举报者觉得不方便，也欢迎直接向司法机关检举。

definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
